snippet: The prime minister, Mykola Azarov, said the agreement for Moscow to provide $15 billion in loans and a steep discount on natural gas meant financial crisis had been averted.
abstract: Ukrainian officials praise financial aid package from Russia as country’s only hope to prevent economic collapse, although it is signed in defiance of a large and sustained antigovernment protest; Prime Min Mykola Azarov says agreement for Moscow to provide $15 billion in loans and a steep discount on natural gas means financial crisis has been averted.

byline.contributor: Melissa Eddy contributed reporting from Berlin, and Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura from London.

lead_paragraph: The prime minister, Mykola Azarov, said the agreement for Moscow to provide $15 billion in loans and a steep discount on natural gas meant financial crisis had been averted.

headline.main: Ukraine’s Premier Hails Russian Aid, Saying Crisis Has Passed
headline.print_headline: Ukraine’s Premier Hails Russian Aid, Saying Crisis Has Passed
